text: Objective: Otitis media with effusion (OME) is an ear disorder defined by the presence of fluid in the middle ear without signs or symptoms of acute infection. The current randomized, double-blind, controlled study aimed to evaluate whether Sinuclean Nebules treatment, administered by nasal douche (Rinowash), could induce ear healing better than isotonic saline in children with OME. Methods: The study was randomized, double-blind, and controlled. Group A (30 children) was treated with Sinuclean Nebules 45 and Group B (31 children) was treated with isotonic saline; both compounds were administered by nasal nebulization with Rinowash nasal douche twice/day in the morning and in the evening for 10 days, followed by a one-week suspension, and after by a second course as the first. Tympanogram and audiometry were performed at baseline and after treatment. Results: Considering the global evaluation of the treatment: in Group A, 28 (93.3%) patients had complete resolution and 2 (6.7%) had partial resolution; in Group B, all patients had failure of treatment. There was a significant difference between groups (p < 0.0001). Conclusion: The current randomized-controlled study demonstrated that Sinuclean Nebules was effective and in the treatment of children with OME.
sentences: Objective: Otitis media with effusion (OME) is an ear disorder defined by the presence of fluid in the middle ear without signs or symptoms of acute infection.

The current randomized, double-blind, controlled study aimed to evaluate whether Sinuclean Nebules treatment, administered by nasal douche (Rinowash), could induce ear healing better than isotonic saline in children with OME.
Methods: The study was randomized, double-blind, and controlled.

Group A (30 children) was treated with Sinuclean Nebules 45 and Group B (31 children) was treated with isotonic saline; both compounds were administered by nasal nebulization with Rinowash nasal douche twice/day in the morning and in the evening for 10 days, followed by a one-week suspension, and after by a second course as the first.
Tympanogram and audiometry were performed at baseline and after treatment.

Results: Considering the global evaluation of the treatment: in Group A, 28 (93.3%) patients had complete resolution and 2 (6.7%) had partial resolution; in Group B, all patients had failure of treatment.
There was a significant difference between groups (p < 0.0001).
Conclusion: The current randomized-controlled study demonstrated that Sinuclean Nebules was effective and in the treatment of children with OME.

text: Otitis media with effusion (OME) is an ear disorder defined by the presence of fluid in the middle ear without signs or symptoms of acute infection [1] . OME is very common as about 90% of preschoolers may have OME [2] . In primary school, about 1 in 8 children are found to have OME in one or both ears [3] . So the direct and indirect costs are particularly impressive [4] . On the other hand, OME should be differentiated from acute otitis media (AOM) is characterized by rapid onset of symptoms (mainly ear pain) and signs (bulging eardrum) due to inflammation of the middle ear [5] . OME may occur spontaneously as consequence of poor Eustachian tube function, during an acute episode of upper respiratory infection, or after AOM as inflammatory sequela [6] .
sentences: Otitis media with effusion (OME) is an ear disorder defined by the presence of fluid in the middle ear without signs or symptoms of acute infection [1] .
OME is very common as about 90% of preschoolers may have OME [2] .
In primary school, about 1 in 8 children are found to have OME in one or both ears [3] .
So the direct and indirect costs are particularly impressive [4] .

On the other hand, OME should be differentiated from acute otitis media (AOM) is characterized by rapid onset of symptoms (mainly ear pain) and signs (bulging eardrum) due to inflammation of the middle ear [5] .
OME may occur spontaneously as consequence of poor Eustachian tube function, during an acute episode of upper respiratory infection, or after AOM as inflammatory sequela [6] .

text: Frequently, OME resolves spontaneously within 3 months, but about 30e40% of children have repeated episodes, and 5e10% of episodes may last more than one year [7] . The persistence of fluid into the middle ear causes reduced mobility of the tympanic membrane and consequently may affect the sound conduction. If OME persists, some symptoms may be associated, such as hearing loss, balance problems, ear discomfort, poor school performance, behavioural problems, recurrent AOM, or impaired quality of life [8] . Rarely, OME induces structural damage to the tympanic membrane requiring surgery [9] . OME requires an adequate differential diagnosis with AOM. Both disorders share the fluid presence in the middle ear cavity, but AOM is characterized by bulging tympanic membrane and signs and symptoms of acute inflammation (pain, erythema, otorrhea, and fever), OME may have normal membrane, and usually there are no symptoms and signs of acute inflammatory reaction. Pneumatic otoscopy is recommended as primary exam. Tympanometry and audiometry complete the diagnostic work-up. In this regard, there are 3 types of tympanogram: A (normal, with a sharp peak), B (flat: very probable OME), and C (mild peak: possible OME). So, a correct OME diagnosis is fundamental to define an appropriate management that includes adequate counselling.
sentences: Frequently, OME resolves spontaneously within 3 months, but about 30e40% of children have repeated episodes, and 5e10% of episodes may last more than one year [7] .
The persistence of fluid into the middle ear causes reduced mobility of the tympanic membrane and consequently may affect the sound conduction.

If OME persists, some symptoms may be associated, such as hearing loss, balance problems, ear discomfort, poor school performance, behavioural problems, recurrent AOM, or impaired quality of life [8] .
Rarely, OME induces structural damage to the tympanic membrane requiring surgery [9] .
OME requires an adequate differential diagnosis with AOM.

Both disorders share the fluid presence in the middle ear cavity, but AOM is characterized by bulging tympanic membrane and signs and symptoms of acute inflammation (pain, erythema, otorrhea, and fever), OME may have normal membrane, and usually there are no symptoms and signs of acute inflammatory reaction.
Pneumatic otoscopy is recommended as primary exam.
Tympanometry and audiometry complete the diagnostic work-up.
In this regard, there are 3 types of tympanogram: A (normal, with a sharp peak), B (flat: very probable OME), and C (mild peak: possible OME).
So, a correct OME diagnosis is fundamental to define an appropriate management that includes adequate counselling.

text: About the treatment, different strategies have been proposed, but there is no EBM gold standard at present. Antibiotics, corticosteroids (both systemic and intranasal), mucolytics, antihistamines, and decongestants are commonly prescribed, but current American guidelines do not recommend these medications for treating OME [1] . Thus, there may be interest to investigate alternative medicine. In this regard, Sinuclean is on the market in Italy as CE marked Class I medical device. Sinuclean is a water solution containing the extract of the plant Ecballium elaterium. Its extract contains various types of cucurbitacins, including B, D, I, and E. Cucurbitacins are tetracyclic triterpenes glycosides which have pharmacological activity. In fact, it has been reported that cucurbitacins may exert immune-modulatory effects [10e13]. In particular, it has been reported an inhibitory activity on cyclo-oxygenase-2 enzymes mediated through blocking of NF-kB activation. In addition, cucurbitacins have an important secretagogue activity able to drain effusive fluids (data on file). The Sinuclean Nebules is a new derivate that is indicated for the facilitation of discharging the mucus from airways and for reducing the mucosal oedema because of its osmotic and anti-inflammatory activity. It may be used by the nasal douche Rhinowash that allows a better distribution of the compound into upper airways, so it could permit the evacuation of accumulated mucus. In fact, mucus stagnation in upper airways, mainly concerning Eustachio's tube, blocks the air circulation promoting a vicious circle causing OME. So, we tested the hypothesis that increased mucus discharge may accelerate the resolution of congested airways, so accelerating mucosal healing and definitively OME resolution. The current randomized, double-blind, controlled study aimed to evaluate whether Sinuclean Nebules treatment, administered by nasal douche (Rinowash), could induce ear healing better than isotonic saline in children with OME.
sentences: About the treatment, different strategies have been proposed, but there is no EBM gold standard at present.

Antibiotics, corticosteroids (both systemic and intranasal), mucolytics, antihistamines, and decongestants are commonly prescribed, but current American guidelines do not recommend these medications for treating OME [1] .
Thus, there may be interest to investigate alternative medicine.
In this regard, Sinuclean is on the market in Italy as CE marked Class I medical device.
Sinuclean is a water solution containing the extract of the plant Ecballium elaterium.
Its extract contains various types of cucurbitacins, including B, D, I, and E. Cucurbitacins are tetracyclic triterpenes glycosides which have pharmacological activity.
In fact, it has been reported that cucurbitacins may exert immune-modulatory effects [10e13].
In particular, it has been reported an inhibitory activity on cyclo-oxygenase-2 enzymes mediated through blocking of NF-kB activation.
In addition, cucurbitacins have an important secretagogue activity able to drain effusive fluids (data on file).

The Sinuclean Nebules is a new derivate that is indicated for the facilitation of discharging the mucus from airways and for reducing the mucosal oedema because of its osmotic and anti-inflammatory activity.
It may be used by the nasal douche Rhinowash that allows a better distribution of the compound into upper airways, so it could permit the evacuation of accumulated mucus.
In fact, mucus stagnation in upper airways, mainly concerning Eustachio's tube, blocks the air circulation promoting a vicious circle causing OME.
So, we tested the hypothesis that increased mucus discharge may accelerate the resolution of congested airways, so accelerating mucosal healing and definitively OME resolution.

The current randomized, double-blind, controlled study aimed to evaluate whether Sinuclean Nebules treatment, administered by nasal douche (Rinowash), could induce ear healing better than isotonic saline in children with OME.

text: This study was a randomized, double-blind, parallel, controlled trial. Primary endpoint was the resolution of ear fluid effusion assessed by tympanometry, secondary endpoint was functional recovery of hearing loss, if documented.
sentences: This study was a randomized, double-blind, parallel, controlled trial.
Primary endpoint was the resolution of ear fluid effusion assessed by tympanometry, secondary endpoint was functional recovery of hearing loss, if documented.

text: Inclusion criteria were: i) age ranging between 3 and 9 years, ii) both genders, iii) documented diagnosis of OME (mono-or bilateral), based on type B tympanogram, since at least 3 months, iv) written informed consent by parents. Exclusion criteria were: i) previous adeno-tonsillectomy, ii) velo-palatal insufficiency and labiopalatoschisis, iii) perceptive or mixed hypoacusia, iv) chronic metabolic disorders, v) interfering medications, vi) presence of disorders potentially interfering with the assessment of the experimental therapy (i.e. viral or allergic rhinitis, syndrome of immobile cilia, cystic fibrosis, immunodeficiency, upper respiratory infection, Down syndrome, dental malocclusion, immunodeficiency), vii) participation to other trials in the last month.
sentences: Inclusion criteria were: i) age ranging between 3 and 9 years, ii) both genders, iii) documented diagnosis of OME (mono-or bilateral), based on type B tympanogram, since at least 3 months, iv) written informed consent by parents.

Exclusion criteria were: i) previous adeno-tonsillectomy, ii) velo-palatal insufficiency and labiopalatoschisis, iii) perceptive or mixed hypoacusia, iv) chronic metabolic disorders, v) interfering medications, vi) presence of disorders potentially interfering with the assessment of the experimental therapy (i.e. viral or allergic rhinitis, syndrome of immobile cilia, cystic fibrosis, immunodeficiency, upper respiratory infection, Down syndrome, dental malocclusion, immunodeficiency), vii) participation to other trials in the last month.

text: The Ethics Committee of the Hospital San Gennaro Hospital of Naples approved the study. A signed informed consent was given to both parents of enrolled children. The study was registered at ClinicalTrials.gov (Identifier: NCT02858388).
sentences: The Ethics Committee of the Hospital San Gennaro Hospital of Naples approved the study.
A signed informed consent was given to both parents of enrolled children.
The study was registered at ClinicalTrials.gov (Identifier: NCT02858388).

text: Children were randomly (according to a blind code with 1:1 ratio) assigned to one arm of treatment: Group A was treated with the active drug: Sinuclean Nebules 45, watery solution containing cucurbitacines B-D-I-E (glycosylates triterpenes) 45 mcg. Group B was treated with isotonic saline.
sentences: Children were randomly (according to a blind code with 1:1 ratio) assigned to one arm of treatment: Group A was treated with the active drug: Sinuclean Nebules 45, watery solution containing cucurbitacines B-D-I-E (glycosylates triterpenes) 45 mcg.
Group B was treated with isotonic saline.

text: Both compounds were administered by nasal nebulization with Rinowash nasal douche twice/day in the morning and in the evening for 10 days, followed by a one-week suspension, and after by a second course as the first.
sentences: Both compounds were administered by nasal nebulization with Rinowash nasal douche twice/day in the morning and in the evening for 10 days, followed by a one-week suspension, and after by a second course as the first.

text: Children were visited at baseline and at the end of the treatment. During every visit, complete ENT examination, tympanometry, and audiometry were performed.
sentences: Children were visited at baseline and at the end of the treatment.
During every visit, complete ENT examination, tympanometry, and audiometry were performed.

text: Otoscopy was performed by paediatric fiberoptic rigid endoscope, with 0 angle of vision (Karl Storz), using a 300-W cold light source (Storz Xenon NOVA).
sentences: Otoscopy was performed by paediatric fiberoptic rigid endoscope, with 0 angle of vision (Karl Storz), using a 300-W cold light source (Storz Xenon NOVA).

text: Tympanogram was performed by Madsen Zodiac (901) instrument. The response was rated as 3 tympanogram types: type A ¼ sharp slope (normal); type B ¼ flat (diagnostic for OME); and type C ¼ discernible peak with negative middle ear pressure level (considered not pathological).
sentences: Tympanogram was performed by Madsen Zodiac (901) instrument.

The response was rated as 3 tympanogram types: type A ¼ sharp slope (normal); type B ¼ flat (diagnostic for OME); and type C ¼ discernible peak with negative middle ear pressure level (considered not pathological).

text: Tonal audiometry was also performed by Madsen instrument in a silent cabin for frequencies ranging between 250 and 4000 Hz. Normal hearing was defined as perception of tones up to 25 dB. Impaired hearing was classified as: mild hypoacusis (hearing loss between 25 and 39 dB), moderate hypoacusis (hearing loss between 40 and 69 dB), and severe hypoacusis (hearing loss between 70 and 89 dB).
sentences: Tonal audiometry was also performed by Madsen instrument in a silent cabin for frequencies ranging between 250 and 4000 Hz.

Normal hearing was defined as perception of tones up to 25 dB. Impaired hearing was classified as: mild hypoacusis (hearing loss between 25 and 39 dB), moderate hypoacusis (hearing loss between 40 and 69 dB), and severe hypoacusis (hearing loss between 70 and 89 dB).

text: Adherence to treatment was evaluated by the number of administered doses recorded in a diary by the caregivers.
sentences: Adherence to treatment was evaluated by the number of administered doses recorded in a diary by the caregivers.

text: The global evaluation of treatment was calculated per patient. The population was subdivided in two subgroups considering the presence of OME if unilateral or bilateral. For patients with unilateral OME, outcomes were defined in terms of resolution or failure; for patients with bilateral OME outcomes were defined in terms of complete resolution (both ears), partial resolution (one ear), or failure (no ear).
sentences: The global evaluation of treatment was calculated per patient.
The population was subdivided in two subgroups considering the presence of OME if unilateral or bilateral.

For patients with unilateral OME, outcomes were defined in terms of resolution or failure; for patients with bilateral OME outcomes were defined in terms of complete resolution (both ears), partial resolution (one ear), or failure (no ear).

text: A descriptive analysis has been performed using frequency tables for qualitative variables, and mean and standard deviation, median and interquartile range for quantitative variables.

text: Comparison of categorical variables were made using chi-square and Fisher exact tests where appropriate, and a p value < 0,05 was considered significant.
sentences: Comparison of categorical variables were made using chi-square and Fisher exact tests where appropriate, and a p value < 0,05 was considered significant.

text: Both treatments were well tolerated and no side effect was observed.
sentences: Both treatments were well tolerated and no side effect was observed.

text: Of the 70 patients enrolled, 9 dropped out because of reasons independent of treatment. Therefore, the analysis included 61 patients, of which 30 (15 males, mean age 5.9 ± 2.7 years) were assigned to Group A and 31 (12 males, mean age 6.1 ± 1.9 years) were assigned to Group B (Fig. 1) . After the randomization, baseline demographic characteristics as age, height and weight were equally distributed in the 2 groups. Clinical characteristics at baseline were revealed through tympanogram and audiometry. Baseline characteristics, including demographic, socioeconomic, and diseasespecific information, are reported in Table 1 .

text: OME represents an intriguing challenge for both the ENT specialist and the paediatrician. The OME diagnosis requires adequate procedure and precise differential diagnosis, mainly concerning AOM. Moreover, OME therapy is controversial as current proposed treatments are not supported by EBM data. So, antibiotics, mucolytics, corticosteroids (both topical and systemic), antihistamines, and decongestants are usually prescribed, but the real efficacy is not well documented, as recently reported by practice guidelines [1] . In this regard, the present study investigated the potential role of Sinuclean Nebules in the treatment of children with OME.
sentences: OME represents an intriguing challenge for both the ENT specialist and the paediatrician.
The OME diagnosis requires adequate procedure and precise differential diagnosis, mainly concerning AOM.
Moreover, OME therapy is controversial as current proposed treatments are not supported by EBM data.

So, antibiotics, mucolytics, corticosteroids (both topical and systemic), antihistamines, and decongestants are usually prescribed, but the real efficacy is not well documented, as recently reported by practice guidelines [1] .
In this regard, the present study investigated the potential role of Sinuclean Nebules in the treatment of children with OME.

text: The findings showed that Sinuclean Nebules was able to induce healing in a high percentage of patients with OME and was significant superior than isotonic saline. Sinuclean Nebules was Outcome in patients with unilateral OME Resolution, n (%) 24 (80%) 0 (0%) Failure, n (%) 0 (0%) 27 (87.10%) Outcome in patients with bilateral OME Complete resolution, n (%) 4 (13.33%) 0 (0%) Partial resolution, n (%) 2 (6.67%) 0 (0%) Failure, n (%) 0 (0%) 4 (19.90%) On the other hand, conventional treatments are not supported by recent guidelines [1] . In this regard, the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality reported that oral steroids were of no significant benefit either in resolution of the effusion or in improving hearing loss [14] . The use of intranasal corticosteroids may induce a short-term benefit in children with adenoid hypertrophy and/or allergic rhinitis [15e17]. About antibiotics, a Cochrane review reported a small benefit for complete resolution of ear effusion [18] . A systematic review on the use of antihistamines and/or decongestants in the OME treatment did not provide evidence about their effectiveness [19] . Therefore, there is reasonable room to investigate new compounds [20] . The current study therefore provides preliminary evidence that Sinuclean Nebules may be a reliable option in OME treatment. Of note, no side effects were reported.
sentences: The findings showed that Sinuclean Nebules was able to induce healing in a high percentage of patients with OME and was significant superior than isotonic saline.

Sinuclean Nebules was Outcome in patients with unilateral OME Resolution, n (%) 24 (80%) 0 (0%) Failure, n (%) 0 (0%) 27 (87.10%) Outcome in patients with bilateral OME Complete resolution, n (%) 4 (13.33%) 0 (0%) Partial resolution, n (%) 2 (6.67%) 0 (0%) Failure, n (%) 0 (0%) 4 (19.90%) On the other hand, conventional treatments are not supported by recent guidelines [1] .
In this regard, the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality reported that oral steroids were of no significant benefit either in resolution of the effusion or in improving hearing loss [14] .
The use of intranasal corticosteroids may induce a short-term benefit in children with adenoid hypertrophy and/or allergic rhinitis [15e17].
About antibiotics, a Cochrane review reported a small benefit for complete resolution of ear effusion [18] .
A systematic review on the use of antihistamines and/or decongestants in the OME treatment did not provide evidence about their effectiveness [19] .
Therefore, there is reasonable room to investigate new compounds [20] .
The current study therefore provides preliminary evidence that Sinuclean Nebules may be a reliable option in OME treatment.
Of note, no side effects were reported.

text: However, the present study has some limitations: i) to be singlecenter, ii) to be based on a restricted number of patients; and iii) to have a short-term follow-up. On the other hand, the study was performed as double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized, and parallel, so the outcomes could be reasonably considered convincing. Anyway, further studies should be conducted to define the unmet needs.
sentences: However, the present study has some limitations: i) to be singlecenter, ii) to be based on a restricted number of patients; and iii) to have a short-term follow-up.
On the other hand, the study was performed as double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized, and parallel, so the outcomes could be reasonably considered convincing.
Anyway, further studies should be conducted to define the unmet needs.

text: In conclusion, the current randomized-controlled study demonstrated that Sinuclean Nebules is effective in the treatment of children with OME.
sentences: In conclusion, the current randomized-controlled study demonstrated that Sinuclean Nebules is effective in the treatment of children with OME.
